tool.name: Scmap index cells
tool.description: creates a cell index for a dataset to enable fast approximate nearest neighbour search
tool.command: scmap-preprocess-sce.R --input-object "${input_single_cell_experiment}" --output-sce-object sce_object_preprocessed.rds && scmap-index-cell.R --input-object-file sce_object_preprocessed.rds --output-object-file '$output_single_cell_experiment' --random-seed '$random_seed' #if $train_id --train-id '${train_id}' #end if #if $n_chunks --number-chunks '$n_chunks' #end if #if $n_clusters --number-clusters '$n_clusters' #end if

param.name: input_single_cell_experiment
param.label: SingleCellExperiment object
param.help: File with serialized SingleCellExperiment object as produced by 'scmap select features'

param.name: n_chunks
param.label: Number of chunks
param.help: Number of chunks into which the expr matrix is split

param.name: n_clusters
param.label: Number of clusters
param.help: Number of clusters per group for k-means clustering

param.name: random_seed
param.label: Random seed
param.help: scmap-cell contains k-means step which makes it stochastic, i.e. running it multiple times will provide slightly different results. A fixed random seed ensures reproducibility.
